title: Wrongs and Injustices
description: After rolling: odd number means it's something character has done, even number means some other person has done to the character.

outcomes.description: Sold an item that did not operate as promised. Refused a refund.
Made light of a political, social, or business disaster. Deliberately escalated when challenged.
Borrowed money, refused to repay. Documentation mysteriously vanished.
Accidentally killed a beloved pet. Promised compensation, never delivered.
Ancestors famously duelled. Children raised to maintain the feud at all costs.
Hired a friend or relative. Lax safety measures and ambitious plans left them crippled and impoverished.
Convinced a dying family patriarch to change their will at the last moment.
Twisted the mind and views of a close friend through subtle hints and vague aspersions.
Promised to denounce an unscrupulous mutual rival; took the rival’s side instead.
Ensnared in a series of duels or brawls. Each time, the stakes and passions escalate.
Made generous loans, then called in all debts at once. Bankruptcy, degradation, madness swiftly followed.
Wormed their way into a position of trust, then absconded with funds, information, and other valuables.
Stole a story and passed it off as their own. Dined out on borrowed deeds for years.
A relative was accused of a minor crime, but vindictively sentenced to a horrible death as a warning to others.
Satirical character in their popular novel infuriates and exposes intimate secrets.
Cowardice or incompetence in war lead to disaster. Left for dead, along with the secret of that dreadful day.
Professional rival sabotaged a critical business deal. Total collapse. Business sold at a loss to rival’s proxy.
Seduced and abandoned a relative, leaving only debt and disease behind.
Asked for help, then let the full force of the law fall upon duped accomplices.
Hired a close friend for a prominent position, only to humiliate and demean them into an early grave.
For sport, lured a naive relative into a life of vice.
Stole a family heirloom or memento. Was it kleptomania or cruelty?
Casually murdered a close relative. There’s no proof, of course. All witnesses vanished years ago.
Inspired servants or close associates to revolt and abandon their duties.
Stole an inheritance through legal chicanery. All perfectly legitimate but deeply unscrupulous.
Devastating, quotable, and hilarious epigram reduced a lifetime’s work to a joke.
Childhood bully, schoolhouse lout, or thuggish fellow apprentice. Never misses a chance to reminisce.
Ancestral lawsuit traps each new generation in the same ancient and notorious feud.
A strategic marriage turned sour. Hidden acts of cruelty and violence. A deathbed request to seek revenge.
Provided a despondent relative with poison and reasons to use it.
By-products of magical experimentation poisoned and warped a close friend.
Promised a safe investment. Fled with money, leaving a trail of ruined investors.
Received credit from the Monarch for work they stole from a relative.
Spread a truly diabolical rumour, forever soiling both name and reputation.
Used illegal spells to obtain a position of power and influence.
Blackmail. They hold critical evidence that could, if published, demolish dozens of careers.
Fell in love with the same person. They won by deceit, bribery, and forged letters.
Stole a business idea. Went on to great success; refuses to credit to all others.
Arson destroyed the family home. A mysterious cloaked figure was seen laughing as the flames spread.
Ungrateful apprentice, servant, or assistant plots the destruction of their former master.
Pushed a mob towards violence, then directed the violence at enemies and rivals.
Replaced life-saving medicine with ineffective substitutes. Relatives perished despite the efforts of physicians.
Former best friend or ally turned implacable rival. Cold, calculated insults and maneuvers.
Ambitious land acquisition program pushed vulnerable people from their homes.
Falsely arrests over a perceived offense. Forced innocent victims to adopt new names and professions.
A deviating night of sabotage perpetrated by ignorant pawns.
Wrote florid love letters, then anonymously published the cruelly edited replies.
Profusely promised assistance, then strung out replies as long as possible, slowly letting hope fade.
Used magic to turn a close relative into a rat, then released them into the sewers.
Simple, primal hatred. No logic, no backstory, no possibility of compromise.
